website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for tough weeds and serious brush, but too harsh for killing basic weeds and unwanted grass.
pros: A powerful weed killer that tackles hard-to-kill growth
Also effective at killing vines, brush, and some small stumps
cons: resistant weeds take a few days to several weeks
Care must be taken to keep it from drifting to unintended plants
Some owners say their dogs tried to lick treated areas.Not concentrated

customer_reviews.title: Kills Chinese (Siberian) Elm Shoots when Nothing Else Will
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to kill some Siberian Elm trees (some people call them Chinese Elm but I'm talking about Ulmus pumila) for years. The original trees were cut down almost EIGHT years ago, but shoots just keep returning. RoundUp doesn't kill them, starving them for sunlight doesn't kill them, digging roots doesn't kill them. They're seemingly indestructible. But spray this stuff directly on the shoots and a week or two later they're dead. They may try to shoot once or twice more, but spray again and they're gone for good. I'd pay ten times the price of this for that level of success. Wonderful, DEADLY stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Cavallo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for invading vines!
customer_reviews.text: We are surrounded by neighbors who could care less about their yards, I’ve been battling Oldman’s Beard Clematis and Blackberry vines from two different sides of our fence for two years now. I used this magical stuff and within 2 days (sunny weather has best results), these obnoxious vines have started to shrivel and decay. I started spraying them daily as they are poking through the fence and I’m ok with overkilling them. I can honestly say that I have thoroughly enjoyed watching them slowly die.
customer_reviews.author: Lellie

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a zero if that was available. Ordered 2 and both sprayers did not work. What a pain in the A$@. I ended up using a hose in sprayer and guessing at the flow rate. My guess is a batch of these were defective and someone bought for a cheaper price and is selling on AMZ. How else can you explain that 2 would have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: 2 Months, Nothing Happened!
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this all over kudzu, soaking it 3 times over the course of 8 weeks. It never rained within 48 hours of applying it. I even cut the kudzu roots and soaked them in this stuff too. It's been two months since using it, and the kudzu shows absolutely NO sign of dying. Not the slightest wilt or discoloration. Lots of people on here have had good results, so I am wondering, does this stuff lose strength over time? Did this specific container sit in a warehouse for a few years before I got it? Or would that not even matter? All I know is that it did NOTHING what-so-ever.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It works, just takes a long time
customer_reviews.text: I used this around our property to kill some brush such as Kudzu and it definitely works, but just takes a long time to do so. I sprayed down the brush and didn't start seeing results for about a week. After about 2 weeks, everything was close to being dead or dead. It doesn't seem to do a good job targeting the roots, so after it's dead, I'd suggest pulling what you can, but at least it will be easier to do at this point. I haven't found anything better for the price point and it accomplished what I needed to albeit taking longer than expected to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Too much money for too little satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, I got the same results from a $5 gallon bottle of Spectracide Weed & Grass Killer, as I did this $27 gallon bottle of Bayer Advanced 704655 Brush Killer Plus. You live and you learn.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robear

customer_reviews.title: Killed the blackberry bushes that I hate coming over the fence from a neighbor that just ...
customer_reviews.text: Killed the blackberry bushes that I hate coming over the fence from a neighbor that just doesn't care. Wonderful product! But make sure you only spray the bushes, other things will die if contacted. Also make sure it will be a few days with no rain or water or it washes off.
customer_reviews.author: Aurel Crisan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, kills everything is says it does
customer_reviews.text: Working well, ivy is dying in a week already. Most other weeds are showing signs of dying off too. Worked great with the hose, much easier to hit a large area.
customer_reviews.author: PerkReviews

customer_reviews.title: Brush Killer.
customer_reviews.text: Does nothing to kill the brush in my wooded area. I used a whole bottle to cover an area of brambles, ivy and scrub only to find nothing worked. Will not waste my money on this useless product again.
customer_reviews.author: BARRY E. SCHELL

customer_reviews.title: Carcinogen and causes cancer! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a carcinogen. Not only does it harm the environment but it also causes cancer in humans. Had I known I would not have bought it. It should be prohibited. There are so many lawsuits for products like this as it caused cancer and deaths. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Donna F

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer mechanism did not work
customer_reviews.text: I cant comment on the efficacy of the weed killer as yet, but I could not get the sprayer to work. I followed the directions, got a few spurts and then it stopped. Yes it was turned on to spray, I undid the connection and cap multiple times, made sure to plastic tube was connected and still not luck. I had to pour some of the liquid into a bottle sprayer I had on hand and it worked fine. I will re-review on efficacy after the product has time to work
customer_reviews.author: Pyewackett

customer_reviews.title: Don't apply to just the foliage. Branches and trunks, with cuts and holes, need to be saturated.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to kill Virginia creeper. Worked like a charm! I made small cuts and holes in the main branches and trunk and used a one gallon sprayer to apply. I applied on a day I knew the sun was going to shine full force which I think helped wilt the plant faster. They're all dead and removed. Will reapply to the leftover trunks and large branches. I applied a month ago and I haven't noticed any new regrowth. Hopefully they don't return next spring!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Us
customer_reviews.text: This didn't kill sufficiently. It withered but that's about it. The weeds were about 6-8 inches high in an area about 8x4 feet. Just didn't kill and wither. Round-Up here I come. This is how the product worked for us, your experience may differ.
customer_reviews.author: Katanajo

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a jug full of water?
customer_reviews.text: The container itself is easy to use but I sprayed this liberally on blackberries, English ivy and a variety of other wooded brush about three weeks ago and I have yet to see a discolored leaf. I used it a full 24 hours before any kind of precipitation so I'm at a loss as to why it had absolutely no effect. It wasn't that expensive so no big deal but the time involved was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is magic. It kills all kinds of ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic. It kills all kinds of greenery - we had some unidentifiable stuff that wouldn't respond to other weed killers... this stuff knocked it out. Keep in mind, it takes a few days to totally kill it, so be patient
customer_reviews.author: SPTexas

customer_reviews.title: Broken Sprayer, so far not working
customer_reviews.text: Immediatly out of the box, the plastic sprayer was cracked so it dripped instead of spraying. Took a lot more energy to coat the leaves with drips but spent a lot of time doing it. So far, 24 hours later, can't tell any difference - looks like I just gave all my weeds and ivy a good watering. Avoiding RoundUp at all costs, but having a hard time finding an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: mom2boys

customer_reviews.title: Will not kill Cast Iron plants
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in other areas and it has worked. But I bought this specifically to kill some Cast Iron plants, and they are still growing. My husband cut them all down, but the product does not kill the new shoots that are coming up everywhere. I will keep on trying. I don't know what else to use. There are other desirable plants in the area and do not want to kill them also.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Tomaselli

customer_reviews.title: Spray unit broke just minutes after starting work.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to kill some trumpet vine in my yard. The product may be good but if you can't apply it because the sprayer breaks easily, it's not worth the money. I ended up loosening the cap and pouring it. By the way, I am not a strong person so that isn't why the sprayer broke. It's just not made robust enough. I'm a 76 year old woman.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ingleby

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works;
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works; I wish I knew this product existed many years ago and now I wouldn't have a bunch of trees around my fence. Over the years, repeatedly, I used to cut small branches that sprung around the stumps to no avail. The Brush Killer solved the problem. Even it killed the small tree, about 4' with many branches, growing at the corner next to the gas meter. To get rid of the tree I did spray it 4 times one week apart.
customer_reviews.author: dostoevsky

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer nozzle broken. Product useless.
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer nozzle was broken and did not spray at all, only dripped. After only a few minutes of use it quit entirely. I have been an Amazon customer for years and trusted it to screen suppliers. But lately my trust is shattered. Amazon is now selling damaged goods. I will return this damaged product. I should have read the reviews. Amazon had complaints about broken sprayers and continued to sell them anyway. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I had some really annoying, rural bushes that was trying to take over our fence and yard. Nothing would work on these. After spraying this about 3 weeks ago, I see the Bush drying out! I'm so excited to have my yard back! It really works, just gotta be patient.
customer_reviews.author: ZekieMayaMama2

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer doesn't work but chemical does.
customer_reviews.text: Battery power sprayer very unsatisfactory. The power is there but the spray delivery is inconsistent. Sometimes drips, sometimes sprays. Trigger device doesn't work well either. The chemical does do what it's supposed to--kill certain types of brush. Quickly. I'm going to transfer the liquid to a container that works better. Which is probably what the manufacturer doesn't want.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy5

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with blackberry vines popping up everywhere. I got tired of digging them out, only to have them come back next year. This stuff works! Yes, it does take time to do it, but it works after only 1 application. It took about 2 weeks to kill it all but the blackberrys as well as the salal (which is another big problem) are no more. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D Curry

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works on ivy
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s english ivy - the kind you see climbing a building. We have it on a fence and after three treatments with this it’s fading. It’s tough stuff and this spray finally has it under control
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Working on Crape Myrtles.
customer_reviews.text: Trying to kill Some Crape Myrtle sprouts and so far it's not working. I' have to try a stronger solution than the one recommended or a different product. Update.....I would definitely not recommend this product. I has not worked in killing crape myrtle sprouts with a much stronger solution than directions state. I will buy a different brand locally.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: BioAdvanced 704640B 704640 Brush Killer - This just works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I have an invasive species of brush called Autumn Olive. It spreads like crazy and has huge sharp pointed thorns. This will kill it. I tried it last summer as a sample to see what it would do and it worked. Less than 2 weeks ago I sprayed and the leaves are already yellow and dying. The stuff I sprayed last year did not come back.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Braun

customer_reviews.title: Works way faster and better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a different product a few years ago and I recall that the effects took a few months to be noticeable. I am happy to say that this product did the job quickly with noticeable effects within a few days and have since purchased it again for future use. I am 100% satisfied with my purchase can highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy, but hopefully it works
customer_reviews.text: Product came leaking, there was foul smelling liquid in the amazon bubble envelope it came delivered in. But since I had to wait so long to even get it in the first place I wasn't going to risk returning it and having to wait another 3 weeks for the spray. There must be something wrong with the piece that attaches to the house because no amount on turning/tightening could get a good seal with my hose. I even tried using a different size attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast acting was impressed by how fast it worked in killing the tree to the roots.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O

customer_reviews.title: after 48 hours the weeds didn't show any effect
customer_reviews.text: First the box/delivery was all broken and the spray didn't work. Second, dropped some liquid over some weeds and 48 hours later, absolutely no signal of any effect or reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Vismara

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING! We had poison ivy take over right next to our porch and English ivy getting out of control. Like bad. We used this and then pulled and bagged everything. Sprayed again after and NOTHING has tried coming back and it has been weeks now. I got another bottle to use in a different area of our yard since it worked so good! I am so happy to have the poison ivy gone!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah ray

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased brush killers that laid waste to an entire hillside in less than a week ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to kill weeds in a large planting bed. In the past, I have purchased brush killers that laid waste to an entire hillside in less than a week (I wish I could remember which one). Unfortunately, after applying the Bayer Advanced Brush Killer, I have notice no changes in the weeds at all. It appears as if this product did nothing at all. I thought the product with the hose applicator would make for quick and easy work. I should have just bought some Roundup. At least I know that works. I wouldn't recommend buying this at all. For the $18 I spent, I got one application.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It Worked
customer_reviews.text: Neighbors yard was a mess. Roots kept coming into my yard growing their weeds. Vines climbing over fence into my yard. Poison oak and ivy. I sprayed, with theyre permission, the back yard about 20 feet in. It worked and the roots on my side began to die off. I still have plenty left if they cone back next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Brush
customer_reviews.text: Not very effective. I used ALL of it and it made the brush somewhat unhappy but didn’t kill it. I switched to “cut vine and stump killer” and painstakenly cut each sprout and painted the stuff on and it died DEAD in only 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works well to kill Crepe Myrtle
customer_reviews.text: I had a large Crepe Myrtle removed from my yard last year and now all roots all over have sent up very aggressive suckers that will not die with roundup and don't see much bothered by being cut down. This product has worked much better than roundup. The big and aggressive suckers still need multiple, heavy applications and take a while to die, but at least they die completely instead of just dying back a little and then rebounding.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: works well, but use caution with pets!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. As a previous comment mentioned it doesn't work instantaneously it takes a little while for the brush to start to die but once it does it does! Here's my biggest complaint about this and why I gave it four stars: I have three dogs and even after it dries on the leaves the sent must be attractive to them because even though was dried they wanted to lick the plants and I had an awful time keeping them away from what I had sprayed. It was OK after a couple of days but for those first couple of days it was a nuisance keeping them away. Otherwise it's a great product
customer_reviews.author: DoggieDadVATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Useless product
customer_reviews.text: Was useless product. Was basically water in a bottle. I think one leave turned brown. Didnt kill anything.
customer_reviews.author: Clip

customer_reviews.title: I used entire bottle on a small area and couple of weeks later now, not much happened
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't leave reviews, but this thing is worthless- at least in my case. It didn't do anything I was expecting it to do and killed only 1% of what was sprayed- I used it on a very small area and emptied the entire 24 oz bottle, there was no rain for at least 72hrs. If I could give it 0, I would. I used another brand before with great success and will be going back to using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought two bottles but I didn’t need to!  One bottle was plenty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bottles but I didn’t need them both. Once I sprayed the suckers around my three year old tree they completely collapsed and died within 2 days. I really didn’t need much product. I sprayed the suckers and by the next morning they looked sick; by day two they were gone, roots and all.
customer_reviews.author: Icydog

customer_reviews.title: Good for weeds not poison ivy
customer_reviews.text: It killed some of my weeds very well they we black and crispy after the first go around. After 2 bottles and six applications over the last monst the poison ivy didn't even wilt let alone die. There were about 4 kinds of plants in the brush I was trying to clear it doesn't effect at all, some it wilts but doesn't kill.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I must break you!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works incredibly well. I had this invasive vine thing growing over my neighbors fence and up the side of my house year after year. I got this stuff and sprayed it,...... dead! Took about a week for it to fully die, gave it a 2nd aplication to be sure. This is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: andre p carneiro

customer_reviews.title: Not effective for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to use as control for overgrowth from wooded area that invades my property. As directed, added 1/2 cup to 1 gallon of water & utilized a sprayer to apply to brush areas. I was not happy with 10% success. After waiting 5 (up to 6 weeks labeled) weeks, I attempted again with double the amount of product, 1 cup, per gallon. For this 2nd attempt, approx 50% kill of brush, I am better set to remove debris, but I was expecting better.
customer_reviews.author: patricia kennealy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! It did not work on weeds, kudzu or poison ivy. It only made the tip of these plants brown and after five days still not dead!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer handle didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer handle was broken on arrival so wasn't a lot of use
customer_reviews.author: ChrisR

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer doesn’t work!!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap!! But Once it’s opened how would you send it back? It would spill all over. So I had to purchase a manual sprayer and dump the contents into it to use the product. I Just sprayed the bushes and weeds so I’ll see how the product actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Marie

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I used this diligently and in addition to their lawn treating products. It just didn't work at all for me. I have a section of my lawn being taken over by a ground cover and other reviews had supported this product to be able to tackle the area. However I did not see any change sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Container and Battery Operated Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer never worked properly and the tip came off and was faulty. The container leaked and I lost half the liquid. It takes over a week for any thing I treat to die. I got ripped off!!!
customer_reviews.author: AZ Bentrider

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised. Easy to spray and there is an adjustable "stream" or "spray". I think I will be buying the concentrate next time along with an auto sprayer or hose hookup to cover larger areas
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brush Thriller?
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this product 4 days ago mainly along a back fence line. It hasn't even killed nut grass nor anything else for that matter. Leaves, vines, weeds, are as green today as they were 4 days ago. I am glad for those who have had success, but I must say it has been useless for me!
customer_reviews.author: DRKee

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very invasive plant that was causing trouble with other plants. I apply this product with a pump sprayer. I made two applications about a week apart. I'm not sure I needed two applications, It takes about two weeks to see some wilting and six weeks to look totally dead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leafy critters survived
customer_reviews.text: Sprays easily but fails to kill some weeds. Those pesky weeds growing through our drive are still alive and well. I can't tell you about the blackberries yet since its been raining non stop here in WA State. More to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Enjoy the Journey

customer_reviews.title: I hd high hope, but it's snot working!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hope for this product since I do not like the Round Up alternative. I really tried hard, spraying it to the point of almost soaking onto the ivies, making sure there is no rain for days. Absolutely no effect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Le

customer_reviews.title: Great for blackberry bushes!
customer_reviews.text: I had about 100’Lx40’Wx30’H areaI used approximately 4 gallons. I researched these types of products and added a soap and water to 2 of the gallons about 1/2&1/2 and it took a little bit longer but still works.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: arrived broken-shpp elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken and extremely warm...who knows if it is any good. The lid which is used for measuring arrived broken so i have to search for something to mix it with everytime. ...complete nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great stump killer
customer_reviews.text: I pour this directly on stumps and it has never failed for many stumps. Give them a year and most smaller stumps will even just pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Chad G. Sauvain

customer_reviews.title: not my favorite weed killer
customer_reviews.text: this was a good price but the product is not as effective as round up. It took about 3 weeks to start killing minor weeds inbetween pavers. Dumped the concentrate straight onto ferns and they still are thriving.. Ended up going back over everything with round up.
customer_reviews.author: Deals

customer_reviews.title: Busted/Cracked Nozzle On Spray Gun.
customer_reviews.text: So. I was super excited to get this to tackle the huge amount of poison ivy in my backyard. I bought the one with the electric spray nozzle. I start to get to work and realize the spray nozzle is cracked and the liquid just leaks out of the crack every time you try to spray. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bernadine

customer_reviews.title: Poison sumac.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to kill poison sumac that surrounds the back of the house. It killed the top vines but the roots go six foot down and I am very allergic to poison sumac.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: it works!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for blackberry vines/bush. After applying this chemical, i was a bit skeptical but after 1.5 weeks all the green wines turned to dried out vines all the way down to the root. Love this product!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Works great on clover - but don't apply right after a mow.
customer_reviews.text: This knocked out all the clover and didn't harm my Centipede grass at all. There was one spot that browned for a week or so, but recovered. I think it was because I had just weed-eated a few days prior. My suggestion is not to use this on fresh-cut grass. Maybe give it 5 to 7 days after a mow before applying just to be safe. Seems the fres cut, open grass blades may have not liked the killer.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Lange

customer_reviews.title: 6 weeks but it works!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush killer works great but don’t be in a hurry because it takes about 6 weeks! It changes the way the plant receives nourishment and kills to the root! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Kills English Ivy
customer_reviews.text: One part water, four parts of this product plus a generous squirt of dawn dish soap killed all the actively growing English ivy taking over my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Davis

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing We had a 5 ft thick vine coming over ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing We had a 5 ft thick vine coming over our wall. Handy Person couldn't cut through it after days of cutting, pulling, chopping. First bottle sprayed top 25% 2 weeks ago. It seems to be killing the thing right down the inside to out. Woo Hoo!!! Got more to finish up and keep it that way!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Martin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect miracles with this product
customer_reviews.text: So far this has only killed “light” thin brush and possibly poison ivy. Not too sure about that though as I’m not looking for another war with that stuff.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Others are correct. Sprayer is a problem.
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times. It has a very, very weak spray. The fourth time, it just stopped spraying at all. So it would be hard to give it more than 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: DRK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't kill my weeds!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 applications over a period of 2 weeks the weeds are exactly like they were before I "treated" them! Nothing has even remotely died. I'm an avid gardener and have used weed killers for over 40 years and I've never experienced this.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Barry

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on some plants as advertised, but thistle and Blackberry, not so much. I had high hopes and on most plants it worked as it was suppose to but my main problem, thistle and Blackberry, after three applications, well all I can say is, it is not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Beecher

customer_reviews.title: SPRAYER
customer_reviews.text: Spray worked fine for the first 15 seconds or so,,,,then it just dripped out. I probably got a bottle with a defective trigger. Anyway, I had saved an earlier version empty bottle and transferred the contents into that bottle. (which worked). Either a defective trigger mechanism in the bottle I received or a basic design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Quick Acting
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after finding out the hard way we had lots of Poison Ivy in our backyard. It killed it fast. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Not  all that effective
customer_reviews.text: Took multiple applications over 3 weeks to kill vegetation. Recommend store front purchase and therein local expertise.
customer_reviews.author: grover R.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even put a dent in the poison ivy...
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed the weeds and poison 2 times and this stuff didn’t even put a dent in it. Stick with a better brand and save your $
customer_reviews.author: Derek J. Picard

customer_reviews.title: Leaking bottle and no sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Bottle arrived leaking from the seams and no sprayer was attached rendering this bottle unusable. I can not vouch on whether it works to kill weeds
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Thank You for helping us all that is possible now.
customer_reviews.text: This does a pretty good job, although it did not kill all of the poison ivy. I think the plant is too large. It is my neighbor's plant and I was trying to help her out but she will have to find something stronger. But I won't be spraying it the fumes were too strong for me.
customer_reviews.author: PK I am very sick.

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle cracked and unable to spray with no resolve!
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer nuzzle had a crack in it so it leaked. I looked for replacement part and could find none. So big container and unable to spray. What now?
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: mech.
customer_reviews.text: I spray the bushs I needed to kill also ive that growing like crazy I did not see any changes at all you crap !!!!
customer_reviews.author: james wingate

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I used this to get rid of some annoying suckers that kept popping up under my deck. This stuff killed them very quickly. I also used it to kill off a sapling that was growing into a retaining wall and causing damage. Will definitely use again the next time I see pesky suckers popping up.
customer_reviews.author: Sahara

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money, I sprayed almost the entire container in one small area and the poison ivy is still more alive than ever.
customer_reviews.author: jomiller97

customer_reviews.title: In box with food!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dry disappointed that this was shipped with a box of protein bars!! The bars should have been sent separately.
customer_reviews.author: Bumom

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This does work but it keeps coming back because my next door neighbor has alot in his yard and dont want to take it off
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best Berry Brush Keller EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything to get rid of the berry brushes, nothing worked. Sprayed this on the leaves for 4 or 5 days straight, and just watched them die away. FANTASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product was applied full strength to stumps of brush that I cut down one week earlier. After one month, no growth has occurred!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick G.Barney

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me, get some
customer_reviews.text: Wow bought this over a year ago, used it in a sprayer at medium setting and it killed almost everything, even small saplings!
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Not good for my intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to kill shoots from wax myrtle trees that were cut down 1 1/2 years ago. Shoots do not die.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Same product I have purchased many times. Does not come with a measuring cup, as depicted in picture.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: GONE, DISINTEGRATED, DUST!
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed my Daughter's massive crop of blackberry vines. One week later, she visited me. During our conversation, she excitedly asked. "Mom, do you remember all of those blackberry vines that you sprayed for me? Yes... "They are GONE, DISINTEGRATED, DUST! Big smile.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Underbrush Killer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product to kill underbrush or clean fence rows. Very effective when you follow the recommendation amount for your sprayer
customer_reviews.author: darrel mullis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't kill any weeds or brush, not even grass.
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff as directed, three separate times. Not only did it not kill any brush, weeds, or the wild blackberry bush I needed to kill off, it didn't even kill grass. Maybe I have to use more of then the recommended amount but I used as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t really work still have tons of weeds and bushes growing after spraying the product
customer_reviews.author: Monaz

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Did its job so was pleased with the poison ivy gone! I had been getting that everytime I weedeated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Work As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work very well for me. Only dried up a few branches and did nothing to the poison ivy/oak in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: T Archia

customer_reviews.title: I'll not waste my money again
customer_reviews.text: Real round up concentrate is better I mixed this stuff 3x stronger that instructions said and nothing one guy swears by it one guy hates it
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P.

customer_reviews.title: Kills Asian Jasmine
customer_reviews.text: This is the only thing I have found to kill out of control Asian Jasmine! Takes a couple of sprays, but does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann E Payne

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed on my weeds and kudzu vines, and they died within a few days. Some of the bigger vines are still alive, but will keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Kills Yellow Archangel
customer_reviews.text: This product will kill yellow archangel, a very invasive ground cover that Roundup won't kill.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny B.

customer_reviews.title: not a good product
customer_reviews.text: followed directions and did not work as stated.. Went back to using roundup
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Killed poison ivy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to combat the poison ivy around my property, and it did indeed kill the poison ivy after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Valyrian

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Got rid if all my poison ivy and some random growth that I wanted out.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Girl

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: We have some mean blackberry bushes on our land and the only thing we have found that kills them to the root is this Brush Killer! It takes 2-3 days before you see them begin to die, but they die! It's a killer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Round up replacement
customer_reviews.text: Roundup stopped working so I got this. Works well on tough weeds
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Didn't kill brush
customer_reviews.text: I had to get roundup to finish the job. Sorry naysayers, roundup actually kills brush.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Heaton

product_meta.title: BioAdvanced 704655A Brush Killer Plus, Kills Poison Ivy, Blackberry, Kudzu, 1-Gallon, Ready-To-Use
product_meta.description: Size:1-Gallon| Color:Ready-To-UseWin the battle With brush! If tough brush is trying to take over your yard, fight back with our brush killer products. With penetrating formulas specifically designed to kill the toughest plants down to the roots, you can rid your property of kudzu, poison ivy, poison oak, blackberry, bramble & more. If you want it gone, we've got the solution.
feature_bullets: Special penetrating formula, kills even the toughest plants down to the roots.
Kills kudzu, poison ivy, poison oak, blackberry and bramble
Plus kills 70+ Other types of listed weeds and brush
